fields.name: Dr. Haripada Bhunia
fields.biography: Dr. Haripada Bhunia has completed his Ph.D. degree in the field of polymer from IIT, Kharagpur and has expertise in the area of polymer and environment. After completing Ph.D., he joined Bakelite Hylam Limited, (R & D Center) as Assistant Manager (R&D) and worked in the field of resins and composites (Phenolics, amino resins, unsaturated polyester resins, etc.). Subsequently, he joined Thapar Centre for Industrial Research and Development as a Research Engineer and worked in epoxy resins based insulating varnishes for electrical applications (particularly motors and transformers). At present, he is working as Professor (since 2003) in Department of Chemical Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala and is involved in the research areas of polymer blends and nanocomposites, environment, adsorption, carbon dioxide capture and utilizations. He has guided 34 M.Tech. Dissertations, 7 Ph.D. and is guiding 8 Ph.D. students at present. Dr. Haripada Bhunia has published over 65 research papers in peer reviewed journals and 67 in Conferences/Symposia/Seminars, coauthored 2 book

fields.name: Dr. Dasaroju Gangacharyulu
fields.biography: D. Gangacharyulu is Professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. He obtained his Undergraduate and Postgraduate in Chemical Engineering from University College of Engineering (Autonomous), Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, India. He obtained his Ph.D. in the area of cross flow compact heat exchanger for internal combustion engines from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. His research interests are heat transfer and fluid flow, nanofluids, heat pipes, heat exchangers, energy, and computational fluid dynamic. He served for 5 years in an industry, 3 years in academics and 11 years in Thapar Centre for Industrial Research and Development, Patiala, India besides the present assignment in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology from 2002 onwards.

fields.name: Dr. Rajeev Mehta
fields.biography: Dr. Rajeev Mehta is Professor of Chemical Engineering, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. Dr. Mehta was appointed in 2000 to Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as an Assistant Professor (Reader) in the Department of Chemical Engineering. Here he brought rich research experience in the area of polymers from an earlier stint of about three years at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, Ohio, USA as a scientist, and a 1½ years stint at SRI, Delhi, India. Also, the research training received at Virginia Tech, USA during his Master’s thesis work also broadened his horizons. While abroad in US, Dr. Mehta did very useful work with regard to development of graphitic foams and almost defect free thin films for non-linear optical properties determination, for the US Air Force. Back in India, he developed polyether oil, which has major use in nuclear reactors. At TIET, Dr. Mehta forayed into many new research areas including synthesis, processing of thermosets, and modeling and simulation, in Polymers. He is regarded as an authority in the area of polymer nanocomposites after having worked with nanocomposites of Polylactic acid, Polyurethanes, Epoxy fibre reinforced composites, microwave in-situ processing, etc. His work on the microwave synthesis of Polylactic acid and its nanocomposites has been acknowledged world over. He has also worked in the area of chemical sequestration of carbon dioxide into high value polycarbonates. Working in a very different area, he developed the technology to incorporate the low dielectric strength polymers into cellulose insulating paper, used in transformers. In the just concluded two projects, his research has major implications for the Indian Navy and Army. Working on the project - Processing and characterization of fiber reinforced polymer nanocomposites and their degradation in marine environments, he developed the technology to incorporate nano-filers in the traditional FRP giving products with much reduced ingress of sea water. Also, working on the project - Studies on STF – nanoclay based composites for personal armour systems, he developed a technology which has major implications for the Indian Army, in the area of better protection armour against fast projectiles. However, this technology is still far from the desired results and future projects will utilize the findings of this work in developing better products. His contributions in the area of polymers has been recognized by many awards including a recent award given for the “Best Innovative Young Researcher” at the 4th International Conference on Nanoscience and Nanotechnology (ICONN 2017) at SRM University. This award had been constituted for the first time in the conference, which is the fourth one in this series of the conferences at SRM, and is in addition to the traditional poster and oral presentations awards. Another prestigious award was conferred upon by PlastIndia Foundation, an apex plastics organization of India. Dr. Mehta and his co-worker won the gold trophy in the PlastIndia 2018 held at Gandhinagar, Gujarat, for the category: Best Research in Polymer Sciences, Technology and Engineering. Specifically, the award has been given for our work on “Glass fiber reinforced epoxy-silyated clay nanocomposites”, having implications for the Indian navy. Earlier in 2015, his research work, in the category of Research in the Field of Polymer Science & Technology for the Innovation in “Chemical Fixation of Carbon dioxide and Propylene Oxide to Poly (Propylene Carbonate) and Cyclic Carbonate” was selected as Joint Runners up (from 47 entries from all over the country) for 5th National Award for Technology Innovation in Petrochemicals & Downstream Plastics Processing Industry, given by Ministry of Fertilizers and Chemicals. Represented the university to successfully bag the 3rd FICCI Higher Education Excellence award in the category of Enabling Research, in 2016. He has completed seven research projects, and has 67 peer-reviewed international publications and four encyclopedia chapters to his credit. He has guided 12 PhD students and 27 M.Tech students. His current H index is 16 and the number of citations stands at about 1300, according to Google scholar. Very recently, Dr. Mehta has tried to foray into the interesting world of Entrepreneurship. Towards this, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology facilitated a one-month training program on entrepreneurship at University of Groningen, The Netherlands, during March 2017. Here, Dr. Mehta team won the third prize in the Venture lab weekend at Groningen, The Netherlands, organized by University of Groningen Center for Entrepreneurship.

fields.name: Dr. Raj Kumar Gupta
fields.biography: Dr. Raj Kumar Gupta is Professor of Chemical Engineering, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Patiala. He joined the Department of Chemical Engineering in 1999. He was appointed as Head of the Department in 2014. His research interests are in the modeling and simulation of chemical processes. He has published over 20 peer-reviewed papers, guided 3 PhDs and several M.Tech. theses. He was a reviewer of post-doctoral fellowship program of FWO VLAANDEREN (Research Foundation – Flanders), BELGIUM.

fields.name: Dr. Sanghamitra Barman
fields.specialisation: Reaction Engineering and Catalysis, Mass Transfer, Petroleum Refining
fields.biography: Dr. Sanghamitra Barman is Associate Professor in the department of Chemical Engineering, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, Punjab, India. Dr. Barman joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering in February, 2008. She has studied Bachelor of Chemical Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata and Masters of Chemical Engineering from the same institute. She was awarded PhD degree from Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 2006. She has supervised 10 master’s students and 4 Ph.D students out of which 2 Ph.D students were awarded Ph.D degree, others are persuing ph.D. Her research interests include environmentally benign heterogeneous catalysis in Petrochemical and Refinery catalytic processes, Catalyst design, Parametric study, Kinetics and Modeling of heterogeneous reactions. She has 34 publications in international journals of repute.

fields.name: Dr. Sanjeev Kumar Ahuja
fields.specialisation: Modelling & Simulation, Reaction Engg., and Polymers
fields.biography: Dr. Sanjeev Ahuja is working with the Chemical Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2000. Previously, he had worked as a founder faculty member of the Shaheed Bhagat Singh State Technical Campus, Ferozepur, and CR State University of Science and Technology, Murthal. His Ph.D. degree is in process modeling, simulation, and control from Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology. He did his M.E. in Polymer and Chemical Engineering. His current research interests include polymeric films, process modeling of polymer and chemical engineering systems, consistent initialization and emergent behavior of dynamic systems, and reaction Engineering.

fields.name: Dr. Jai Prakash Kushwaha
fields.biography: J P Kushwaha did Ph.D. from Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, India in 2011, and was appointed as Associate Professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, in May, 2011. He has served the Department of Chemical Engineering as co-ordinator of project semester and PG programme. J P Kushwaha has published 23 peer reviewed research papers and two book chapters. Currently, his H- index is 11 with 611 citations.

fields.name: Dr. Avinash Chandra
fields.specialisation: Computational Fluid Dynamics; Industrial Scale RTD Analysis, Non-Newtonian Fluid Flow & Heat Transfer; Radiotracer Applications; Bioprocess & Natural Products

fields.name: Dr. Sudhir Kumar Singh
fields.specialisation: Thermodynamics, Molecular Modeling, Properties of Fluids at Nanoscale
fields.biography: Sudhir Kumar Singh is Associate Professor of Chemical Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology (TIET), Patiala since March 2018. He has joined the department on June 1, 2012 as Assistant Professor. He has worked as project semester coordinator in chemical engineering department from the year 2014 to 2015. He is working as UG coordinator since September 2016. Sudhir has also worked as a DAE-ICT scientist at the Institute of Chemical Technology, Mumbai, India, for a year before joining the TIET, Patiala. Sudhir has got his B. Tech. in Chemical Engineering from the University Institute of Engineering and Technology, CSJM University Kanpur, in 2003 and M. Tech. in Chemical Technology with specialization in Oil Technology from Harcourt Butler Technological Institute (HBTI), Kanpur, in 2005. He obtained Doctorate degree (Ph.D.) in Chemical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, India in 2011. Sudhir researches focus on nanomaterials and studies on thermodynamic properties of bulk and nanoconfined fluids using molecular simulation techniques.

fields.name: Dr. Neetu Singh
fields.specialisation: Separation Processes, Heat Transfer, Modelling and simulation
fields.biography: Dr. Neetu Singh is working with Chemical Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2013. She has completed her PhD degree in Chemical Engineering from UP Technical University, Lucknow in December 2012. Her research interests include Separation processes, CO2 utilization & alternative fuels and Pollution abatement.

fields.name: Dr. Parminder Singh
fields.biography: Mr. Parminder Singh is Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. He is currently pursuing his Ph.D in Chemical Engineering from Energy Research Centre, Panjab University. He is working on the forced convective heat transfer studies of nanofluids through straight tubes and helical coils. He did his M.E. (Chemical) from Dr. S.S.B.U.I.C.E.T, Panjab University in 2007. He also received a Gold medal for scoring top position during his post-graduation. His research interests are heat transfer and fluid flow, nanofluids, heat pipes, helical coils. He is working Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology since 2007 onwards.

fields.name: Rakesh Kumar Gupta
fields.specialisation: Pollution abatement, CFD and Heat transfer
fields.biography: Rakesh Kumar Gupta is working with ChED Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2009. He has completed his M.Tech. degree in Chemical Engineering from Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi in June 2008. His research interests include Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer.

fields.name: Dr. Prem Pal Bansal
fields.specialisation: Structural Engineering, Repair and Rehablitation of Structures, Design of RCC and Steel Structures
fields.biography: Dr. Prem Pal bansal is an Associate Professor & Head at the Dept. of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology since December 1995. He obtained his BE (Gold Medal) in Civil Engineering in year 1993 from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology (TIET) Patiala. He obtained his ME (Gold Medal) in Structural Engineering in year 1995 from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology (TIET) Patiala. He obtained his Ph.D from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala in year 2008. He has extensive teaching and research experience in structural Engineering of more than 21 years. He has guided one completed Ph.D and presently supervising 5 pursuing Ph.D. Candidates. He has guided more than 25 M.E. Dissertation. He has more than 25 papers in various journals and conferences of international reputes. He has supervised six research and infrastructures projects and more than 50 consultancy projects. He has delivered more than ten expert lectures.

fields.name: Dr. Rafat Siddique
fields.role: Sr Professor & Dean of Research and Sponsored Projects
fields.biography: Rafat Siddique is the Senior Professor at the Dept. of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology working since August 1994. He obtained his B.Sc. Engg. in Civil Engineering in year 1986 from national Institute of Technology, Rourkela. He obtained his ME in Structural Engineering in year 1988 from Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani. He obtained his Ph.D from Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani in year 1993. He was engaged for his Post-doc research at University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, USA. He has extensive teaching and research experience in structural Engineering of more than 30 years. He is rated amongst top 15 globally in his research area in Google Scholar with Google H-Factor of 40. He has more than 5400 citations in his name. He has guided ten completed Ph.D and presently supervising 3 pursuing Ph.D. Candidates. He has supervised more than 43 M.E. Dissertation. He has published four books and more than 210 papers in various journals and conferences of international reputes. He is the editor of Construction and Building Materials (Elsevier) and associated editor of Journal of Materials in Civil Engineering (ASCE), Journal of Sustainable Cement-Based Materials (Taylor & Francis), and Journal of King Saud University (Engineering Sciences). He has been invited as guest lecturer and keynote speaker for more than 65 events organized in and outside India. He has attended more than 24 conference of international repute in and outside India. He has supervised eleven sponsored research and infrastructures projects and more than 80 consultancy projects. He has delivered more than ten expert lectures.

fields.name: Dr. Naveen Kwatra
fields.biography: Naveen Kwatra is Professor in Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He was appointed in July 2000 after completing his doctorate from Indian Institute of Roorki, Roorki. His area of expertise is wind effect on RC buildings, finite element modeling, vibration monitoring on RC structure elements, artificial intelligence. Till date, he has completed number of research project sponsored by DST, AICTE and UGC. He has supervised 45 student of ME Structure and 7 PhD students. Naveen kwatra is also worked as a Faculty Advisor for Civil Construction projects of the Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology from 11/2006 to 11/2011. He has published more than 32 SCI journal, more than 22 conference paper and H index is 6. Naveen kwatra is also completed many consultancy project including design of RC structures, retrofitting and rehabilation of RC building. Presently he is associated with NHAI project from Kiratpur to ner chowk, Himachal.

fields.name: Dr. Sarbjit Singh
fields.biography: Sarbjit Singh is Associate Professor in Water Resources section of Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Sarbjit joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology in 1993 as a lecturer. Sarbjit completed his Masters from PEC University of Technology (formerly Panjab Engineering College), Chandigarh in Irrigation and Hydraulic Engineering and Ph. D. from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. Sarbjit has industry experience of 3 years. At Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Sarbjit has been involved in a number of administrative works at the institute and the Department levels.

fields.name: Rajesh Pathak
fields.specialisation: Geo-Tech Engineering, Foundation Design, Liquefaction of soils, Collapse behaviour, Ash Dykes
fields.biography: Rajesh Pathak is Associate Professor in Geotechnical section of Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Rajesh Pathak joined as lecturer in Oct 1994 and has been serving the institute for the last 23 years. He has field experience in various government and private site investigation projects during his stay in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. He has given the consultancy for design of ash dykes for various thermal power plants in Punjab. Now days he is also Road Safety Consultant for various projects of NHAI. Prof. Rajesh Pathak has guided around 18 ME/MTech thesis and various undergraduate group projects. He has been the Programme coordinator for BE Civil Engineering from 2004 to 2015 and Chairman of Time table Committee at university level. He has also been member of various committees at the university level.  Nowadays, he is incharge of Sports activities of Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology and warden of Hostel J.

fields.name: Dr. Shweta Goyal
fields.biography: Dr. Shweta Goyal is an Associate Professor in the Department of Civil Engineering. She joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as Lecturer in 2003. She is University topper throughout her education and was awarded Gold Medal both during under graduate (

fields.name: Dr. Shruti Sharma
fields.biography: Dr. Shruti Sharma is an Associate Professor in the Department of Civil Engineering. She joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as Lecturer in 2004. She is a Gold-Medallist in B.Tech (Bachelors in Civil Engineering) as well as her M.E (Masters in Structural Engineering). She was awarded INAE (Indian National Academy of Engineering) Award for Best Doctoral Thesis in 2011. She has been the Principal Investigator of various research projects sponsored by Govt. of India agencies like AICTE (All India Council of Technical Council), DST (Department of Science and Technology), UGC (University Grants Commission) and NRB (Naval Research Board) amounting to more than 100 lakhs. Her areas of research include health monitoring of infra-structures, sustainability of concrete and application of nano-materials in civil engineering applications. She has more than 30 publications to her credit out of which 15 are SCI indexed. Her H-index is 6 (June 2017). She was given a “Letter of Appreciation by DST” for her wonderful contribution to corrosion monitoring in reinforced concrete structures in a research project. She has developed a “Structural Health Monitoring Laboratory” which has all the latest Non-Destructive Test set-ups (Acoustic Emission, Infra- Red Thermography, Ultrasonic P-R systems, Fibre-Optic sensing technology etc.) which is one of its kind in North India.

fields.name: Dr. Dwarika Nath Ratha
fields.biography: Dwarikanath Ratha is working presently as Associate Professor at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. He was appointed in 2008 to Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as a lecturer and became Associate Professor in the year 2015. He has published over 20 research publication in various Journals and Conferences. His contribution in research has been recognized by award in Journal of Hazardous, Toxic and Radioactive waste, ASCE Journal in the year 2010 and 2013 as best theoretical oriented paper.

fields.name: Dr. Tapas Karmaker
fields.biography: Tapas Karmaker is working as an Associate Professor at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He was appointed to be a part of Civil Engineering faculty in the year 2011. Before joining Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, he was working with Tezpur University, a central university (Assam) in the capacity of Assistant Professor for one year. He earned his Doctorate degree from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India in the year 2011, and his graduate degree is in Civil Engineering. His Ph.D work involved intensive fieldwork, laboratory scale and numerical modeling of river bank erosion. Other than teaching to undergraduate and postgraduate students, he holds Institute/ departmental level responsibilities. As a faculty in charge of survey laboratory, he is handling the issues related to purchase of the state of the art survey instruments. He was president of the student society "Yatharth" for two years. This society was responsible for organizing the inter-branch activities, workshops, seminars etc. Presently he is the member of the Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Student Satellite Programme (THAPSAT).

fields.name: Dr. Richa Babbar
fields.biography: Richa Babbar is working as an Associate Professor at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She was appointed to be a part of Civil Engineering faculty in the year 2010. Before joining Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, she was working with Jaypee University of Information and Technology, Waknaghat (Himachal Pradesh) in the capacity of Assistant Professor for four years. She earned her Doctorate degree from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, India in the year 2008, and her graduate degree is in Civil Engineering. Her Ph.D work involved intensive fieldwork, monitoring and modeling of water quality for its management. Other than teaching to undergraduate and postgraduate students, she holds various Institute/ departmental level responsibilities. As a UG coordinator, she is handling the issues related to UG curriculum, facilitating its design and implementation. She served as Warden of a girl’s hostel having strength of around 270 students for a period of 3 years.  The responsibility called for managing the needs of in house girl students.

fields.name: Neena Garg
fields.biography: Neena garg is working as an Assistant Professor at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She was appointed to be a part of Civil Engineering faculty in the year 1995. She earned her master’s degree from the Punjab Engineering College, Chandigarh in the year 1994, and her graduate degree is in Civil Engineering. She is pursuing her PhD. in transportation engineering from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. Other than teaching to undergraduate and postgraduate students, she holds various Institute/departmental level responsibilities. She has also served as student counseller of the department.

fields.name: Dr. Tanuj Chopra
fields.biography: Dr. Tanuj Chopra is working as a faculty in the Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. He has extensive teaching, consultancy and research experience of 12 years in the field of Transportation & Pavement Engineering. With his vast knowledge and invaluable experience, he has guided more than 50 M.E. Dissertation (thesis) in the field of Transportation Engineering & has more than 35 research publications (including 3 SCI indexed papers) in various journals and conferences of international repute. Presently 3 PhD research scholars are working under him on different Pavement Engineering problems. He has been awarded with teaching excellence award for six times in a row by Thapar University Patiala. Dr. Chopra is currently working on various industrial consultancy projects funded by various central governments, state governments and private organisations. Presently handling around 7 National Highway Projects of NHAI, MORTH & PWD as Deputy Team Leader cum Highway Engineer for Road Safety Audit in the state of Punjab, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Odisha and Bihar. He is a consultant to Punjab PWD, Punjab Urban Development Authority (PUDA), Municipal Corporations, Improvement Trust and many private organisations such as Ashok Buildcon, SP Singla Constructions, Tricone, Techno Rise consultants, Kiranotech engineering and York Builders etc...

fields.name: Dr. Gurbir Kaur
fields.biography: Gurbir Kaur is Assistant Professor of Structural Engineering wing of the Department of Civil Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Patiala since June 2013. Her PhD research work examines the flexural fatigue performance of steel fibre reinforced concrete containing cement additives like flyash, silica fume, metakaolin and lime stone powder. She is recipient of the Thomas Howard Medal-2015: Prize for best paper in journal constructional materials for paper entitling, “Flexural performance of fibrous concrete with cement additions”. Her research interests include fatigue studies of composite materials, recycled aggregates, geopolymer concrete, use of waste materials and industrial by-products in concrete and structural materials. Dr Kaur has taught different civil engineering subjects at both undergraduate and graduate level.

fields.name: Dr. Heaven Singh
fields.specialisation: Experimental Testing of Reinforced Concrete Structures

fields.name: Dr. Aditya Parihar
fields.biography: Aditya Parihar is Assistant Professor in Geotechnical section of Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Aditya was appointed in July 2015 after completing his doctorate from Indian Institute of Science Bengaluru. Formerly an Associate Consultant in ATES, AIMIL Ltd., New Delhi, He has field experience in various site investigation projects. Aditya completed his Masters from Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee in 2007 on “Seismic Response of Retaining walls”. He has experience in numerical modelling problems related to geotechnical engineering and has ample experience of geophysical field investigations like MASW. He has mentored 5 undergraduate group projects in Thapar. He is shouldering the responsibility of UG industrial training coordinator and lab in-charge for geotechnical engineering laboratory now.

fields.name: Dr. Himanshu Chawla
fields.biography: Dr. Himanshu Chawla is working with Civil Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since January 2018. He has completed his PhD degree in Structural Engineering from Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani (BITS Pilani) in 2018. His area of research includes structural behaviour of FRP-concrete hybrid beams, modelling of structures in FEM software (ABAQUS), use of waste materials in concrete and FRP laminates, and FRP bridges.

fields.name: Dr. Trishna Choudhury
fields.biography: Dr. Trishna Choudhury is working with CED Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since December 2018. She has completed her PhD degree in Structural Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati in August 2018. Her research interests include Earthquake Resistant Design of Structures, Structural Damage Assessment, Seismic Risk and Vulnerability Assessment, Performance and Nonlinear Behavior Assessment of Reinforced Concrete Buildings.

fields.name: Dr. Bibekananda Mandal
fields.biography: Dr. Bibekananda Mandal is Visiting Assistant Professor at Department of Civil Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since June 2018. He obtained his B.E. in Civil Engineering in the year 2009 and M.E. in Structural Engineering in the year 2013 from BESU, Shibpur. He continued his research interest in Structural Engineering from IIT Roorkee. He has extensive experience in finite element modelling of fibre reinforced plastic (FRP) structures. He has a keen interest in Structural Engineering, Finite Element Analysis and Mechanics of Laminated Composites. His research areas include finite element analysis of laminated composite joints and thermo-mechanical analysis of FRP bridge decks.

fields.name: Raju Sharma
fields.specialisation: High-Performance Concrete, Retrofitting and Rehabilitation of RC structure

fields.name: Dr. R. K. Sharma
fields.specialisation: Machine Learning, Statistical Methods in Computer Science and NLP

fields.name: Dr. Seema Bawa
fields.specialisation: Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning
fields.biography: Dr. Seema Bawa, holds M.Tech (Computer Science) degree from IIT Khargpur and Ph.D. from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She is currently Professor of Computer Science & Engineering and Professor InCharge Nava Nalanda Central Library at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She is working in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology since 1999. She is Former Dean (Student Affairs) and Former-Head of Computer Sc. & Engg. Department.

fields.name: Dr. Rajesh Kumar
fields.specialisation: Computer Network, Cloud Computing, Software  Engineering
fields.biography: Rajesh Kumar is currently working as Professor in Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He obtained his M.Sc., M. Phil. and Ph. D. degree from IIT Roorkee. He has more than 21 years of UG & PG teaching and research experience. He has more than 98 research papers to his credit in various international and national Journals and conferences. He is member of various professional bodies/societies of repute. His current area of research and interest includes FANETs, Resource Scheduling and Fault tolerance in Clouds.

fields.name: Dr. Inderveer Chana
fields.role: Professor & Associate Head, Dean of SA
fields.specialisation: Cloud Computing, Big Data and IoT; Software Engineering and Software Project Management.

fields.name: Dr. Maninder Singh
fields.specialisation: Network Security, Software Engineering, Parallel and Distributed Computing

fields.name: Dr. Parteek Bhatia
fields.specialisation: NLP, Machine Learning and Human Computer Interface for Education of Hearing Impaired people
fields.biography: Parteek Bhatia is an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He has more than eighteen years of academic experience, including six years at D.A.V College Amritsar. He has earned his B.Tech from SLIET and MS from BITS Pilani. He has completed his Ph.D on "UNL Based Machine Translation System for Punjabi Language" from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. He has published more than 75 research papers and articles in Journals, Conferences and Magazines of repute. His research work with UNDL foundation, Geneva, Switzerland involved participation in Advanced UNL School at Alexandria, EGYPT in 2012 and at Geneva, Switzerland in 2013 and 2014. He is a winner of Gold Medal at International competition UNL Olympiad II,UNL Olympiad III and UNL Olympiad IV conducted by UNDL Foundation in year 2013 and 2014. He has authored six books including  Simplified Approach to DBMS, Simplified Approach to Visual Basic and Simplified Approach to Oracle. He is acting as Principal Investigator of DST Funded research project on "Automatic Generation of Sign Language from Hindi Text for Communication and Education of Hearing Impaired people". He is acting as Co-PI on Royal Academy of Engineering (UK) funded research project on  "Innovative Research in Pedagogy with Mini-MOOCs blended with instruction strategies to enhance quality in Higher Education". He has successfully completed research Project on Development of Indradhanush: An Integrated WordNet for Bengali, Gujarati, Kashmiri, Konkani, Oriya, Punjabi and Urdu Sponsored By Department of Information Technology, Ministry of Communication and Information Technology, Govt. of India.

fields.name: Dr. Rinkle Rani
fields.biography: Dr. Rinkle Rani is working as Associate Professor in Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She has done her Post graduation from BITS, Pilani and Ph.D. from Punjabi University, Patiala. She has more than 20 years of teaching experience. She has supervised 42 M.Tech. dissertations and contributed 60 articles in Conferences and 50 papers in Research Journals. Her areas of interest are Big data mining & Analysis. She is member of professional bodies: ACM, IEEE, ISTE and CSI.

fields.name: Dr. Shalini Batra
fields.biography: Joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology as Faculty in Computer Science and Engineering Dept. in 2002 and is serving the department till date with enthusiasm and dedication. Currently working as an Associate Professor, has guided many Ph.D. and M.E. research scholars. Has authored/co-authored more than 60 research papers in various conferences and journals of repute. Has successfully completed one industry sponsored research project and currently working on one inter department project. Along with teaching and research, has undertaken various responsible administrative positions at department and University level. Served as founder Warden of girls hostel, department DQAR, Student Councilor, Department Souvenir Committee member, NBA/NACC Department Coordinator, etc.

fields.name: Dr. V. P. Singh
fields.specialisation: Computing, Computer Networks, Computer Forensics and Cyber Law

fields.name: Dr. Rajiv Kumar
fields.specialisation: Image Processing, Algorithms (Design and Analysis), Segmentation

fields.name: Dr. Singara Singh
fields.specialisation: Digital Image Processing, Information Security,Machine Learning

fields.name: Dr. Ajay Kumar
fields.specialisation: Theoretical Computer Science and Software Testing

fields.name: Dr. Sharad Saxena
fields.specialisation: Wireless sensor networks, IOT, Ad-hoc networks
fields.biography: Sharad Saxena is Associate Professor in the department of Computer Science and Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, Punjab, India. He did Ph. D. (CSE) 2012 and M. Tech. (CSE) in 2009. He is a member of societies like IEEE, CSI, IAENG and ACM. He is also serving as editor of some the journals and as reviewer. He has published 50 International Papers in the area of Ad-hoc and sensor networks in journal and conferences. He has guided 10 M. Tech. Dissertations and 4 Ph.D. are undergoing. His research interest includes Wireless Sensor Networks, Internet of Things, Cloud computing and Ad-hoc network.

fields.name: Dr. Maninder Kaur
fields.biography: Maninder Kaur is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering , Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She received her Bachelor Degree from Sant Longowal Institute of Engineering and Technology and Master’s degree from Punjabi University. She completed her Ph.D. in the field of VLSI Circuit Partitioning using Evolutionary approach. Her major research experiences and interests include VLSI CAD, Big Data Analytics,Data Mining and Swarm intelligence. She has 25 publications including journals, conferences. She is an associate member of The Institution of Engineers, India. Her current research includes the application of machine learning and swarm intelligence techniques for big data analytics.

fields.name: Dr. Ravinder Kumar
fields.biography: RAVINDER KUMAR received the Ph.D. degree in computer science and engineering from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology in 2015. He is currently an Assistant Professor with the Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. He has already developed a complete working project on speech recognition and handwritten recognition for Indian regional language (Punjabi). His area of research includes theoretical and practical aspects of combinatorial optimization, approximation algorithm, and mathematical programming. He is the member of various professional bodies and serves as a Reviewer to many referred journals.

fields.name: Anil Vashisht
fields.specialisation: Computer Networks, DBMS, System Analysis & Design, Computer System Architecture,Databases , networks
fields.biography: Mr Anil Vashisht is currently working as Assistant Professor in Computer Science and Engineering department of Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala. He obtained his B.Tech From Punjabi University Patiala, India. He is serving Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology since 1996. His primary area of research is evolution of consciousness and meditation.

fields.name: Dr. Vinod Kumar Bhalla
fields.biography: Vinod K Bhalla is an Asst. Professor in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He is equipped with B.E in Computer Sc., M.E in Software Engineering, Diploma in Management and PhD. Degree with major as computer science at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. He has 16 years of teaching and 7 years of Research and Development experience. He joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology in October, 2001 as lecturer and was elevated to position of Asst Professor in 2008. Prior to joining TIET, he served India’s leading corporate research centre as Research Engineer Software for almost 7 years. He is an IBM certified DB2 and Web Sphere Application developer. He is also Brain Bench Certified C++ Engineer. He guided many ME thesis and BE/MCA projects. He has taught numerous courses namely Software Engineering, Software Project Management, Software Design and Construction, Object Oriented Programming, Software Quality Management.

fields.name: Dr. Ashima Singh
fields.specialisation: DevOps, Data Mining and machine intelligence, Software Engineering, Software Components and Reuse
fields.biography: Ashima Singh is Assistant Professor in Computer Science and Engineering Department, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Ashima Singh was appointed, in 2006, to Computer Science and Engineering Department as Assistant Professor. She has earned Ph.D. in Computer Engineering and holds a Master's Degree, with distinction in Computer Science. She has more than ten years of experience in teaching and research both at UG/PG levels. She Has guided many Theses in M.E. Software Engineering and M.E. Computer Science and Engineering. She has more than 45 research publications in reputed peer reviewed journals and conferences. She is member IEEE and Branch Counselor, IEEE Student Chapter at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. She is Coordinator, Student Counseling and Development Cell at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. She has organized various Workshops, Seminars and Technical Events at university level.

fields.name: Dr. Karun Verma
fields.specialisation: Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Human Computer Interfaces, Entrepreneurial Research
fields.biography: Karun Verma received Ph. D. degree for “Efficient Hidden Markov Models for Online Handwritten Gurmukhi Script Recognition” from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology in 2017. He is Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. He is currently pursuing research in the area of soft computing and Handwriting recognition and Natural Language Processing. He has more than fourteen years of teaching experience. He has already developed a complete working project handwritten recognition for Indian regional language (Punjabi). He had also contributed to development of prosodicallly guided phonetic engine for searching speech databases for Indian Languages. He has taught various core subjects at graduate and undergraduate levels and is guiding post graduate students. He provides consultancy in the area of software development and technical education. He has published various research papers in reputed national journals and conference proceedings. He has conducted various courses on Microsoft, Oracle, and Java technologies for students

fields.name: Dr. Rajkumar Tekchandani
fields.biography: Rajkumar Tekchandani is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He has nine years of academic experience, including one year of academic experience at NIT Jalandhar. He received M.Tech degree in Computer Science from Jaypee University of Information Technology, Waknaghat. Currently, he is pursuing his Ph.D in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. His research interests include Software Engineering, Software Code Clone Detection and Data Mining. His current H-index is 3. Till now he has guided ten M.E students for their thesis work.

fields.name: Dr. Vinay Arora
fields.biography: Vinay Arora is Assistant Professor of Computer Science & Engineering, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, Punjab, India. Arora was appointed in 2009, to Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Arora did his masters from Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra, Haryana, India in 2007 and got campus placement in Newgen Software Technologies, New Delhi. Vinay worked for ECOBANK, Ghana, West Africa, and played a major role in analysis, design and implementation of their automation. His areas of interest are meta-heuristic, software models and software testing.

fields.name: Dr. Sunita Garhwal
fields.biography: Sunita Garhwal is an assistant professor at the Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. She obtained her M. Tech. in Software Engineering from Kurukshetra University in 2007. Currently, she is pursuing her PhD degree in Automata Theory from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. She has almost ten years of teaching experience in the area of Compiler design, Theory of Computation, Graph theory and Data structures. Her research interest focuses on fuzzy automata theory and software engineering.

fields.biography: Dr. Shreelekha Pandey is Assistant Professor at Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology Patiala. She received BE degree (2007) from GGITS, Jabalpur and ME degree (2010) from SGSITS, Indore in computer science. She has completed PhD degree (2015) in computer science from IIITDM Jabalpur, India. She also worked at Indian Institute of Information Technology, Kota, India.

fields.name: Dr. Shivendra Shivani
fields.biography: Shivendra Shivani is currently working in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala as Asst. Professor. He has received his B.E. degree, in computer science and engineering from CSVTU in 2009, after that he has completed master degree from National Institute of Technology Allahabad, India in Information security in 2011. He has received Ph.D. degree from National Institute of Technology Allahabad, India with Visual Cryptography as an area of interest. His current research interest includes Digital watermarking, Pattern Recognition, Computer Vision, Algorithms, Compression, Biometrics, Visual Cryptography and Face recognition.

fields.name: Dr. Sangita Roy
fields.specialisation: Network Security, Cryptography, Steganography, IoT, Image Processing

fields.name: Dr. Raman Kumar Goyal
fields.biography: Dr. Raman Kumar Goyal is working as an Assistant Professor in Computer Science and Engineering. He completed his B.Tech in Computer Engineering from Punjabi University Patiala in 2007. He received his M.E. and Ph.D. from Panjab University Chandigarh in 2009 and 2017 respectively.

fields.name: Dr. Rajesh Mehta
fields.specialisation: Image Processing and Machine Learning Algorithms

fields.biography: Nidhi Kalra is a Assistant Professor in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology. She has done her PhD in Computer Science and Engineering Department from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Master of Engineering from PEC Univ of Technology, Chandigarh, India and B.Tech from AIET, PTU, (Pb.) India. Her main research interests are Theoretical Computer Science, Smartphone Sensors and Application of formal grammar in Biology. She is the member of IEEE and ACM. Contact her at kalranidhi8@gmail.com, nidhi.kalra@thapar.edu

She obtained her B.E. from the RGPV, Bhopal, India, and M. Tech. from B.I.T. Mesra, Ranchi (Jharkhand), India. She received her PhD degree from JUET, Guna, in 2016. She also worked as Project Engineer in Wipro Technologies for 2 years.

fields.name: Dr. Tarunpreet Bhatia

fields.name: Dr. Rohit Ahuja

fields.biography: Rohit Ahuja is presently working as a Lecturer in department of computer science and Engineering in Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala. He obtained his B.E. with Honours from RGPV Bhopal and M.Tech with Distinction in computer science from Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore. He is pursuing Ph.D. from Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing Jabalpur, M.P. in Computer science and Engineering.

fields.name: Dr. Rajendra Kumar Roul
fields.specialisation: Information Retrieval, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Database
fields.biography: Dr. Rajendra Kumar Roul is currently working as Assistant Professor in Computer Science and Engineering Department. He obtained his MCA from NIT, Jamhedpur, India, and M.E. from College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, India. He received his Ph.D. degree from BITS, Pilani in 2017. He has over 36 research papers, out of which 12 are in international journals and 24 are in conferences. He has guided 10 undergraduate thesis and 5 postgraduate thesis.

fields.name: Dr. Karamjeet Singh

fields.name: Dr. Palika Chopra
fields.specialisation: System Administration, Application Development, Database Administration & Computer Networks.
fields.biography: Dr. Palika Chopra is working with Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2008. She has completed her PhD degree in Neuro-Computing Techniques from Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology in December 2017. Her research interests include Data Mining and Machine Learning Techniques.

fields.name: Dr. Nitin Saxena
fields.specialisation: Nature Inspired Optimization Techniques, Digital Image Watermarking
fields.biography: Nitin Saxena is currently working in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala as Lecturer. He has received his MCA degree from UPTU in 2003, after that he has completed M.Tech. (Information Security) from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad, Allahaabd, in 2009. He is pursuing his Ph.D. from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad, Allahabad, India in the area of Particle Swarm Optimization. His research focus is on Nature Inspired Optimization Techniques and their applications in Digital Image Processing, Cloud Computing etc.

fields.name: Dr. Jasmeet Singh
fields.specialisation: Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Text Mining
fields.biography: Mr. Jasmeet Singh is currently working as Lecturer in the Computer Science Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala. He obtained his B.Tech and M.Tech from PTU, Jalandhar. He is pursuing PhD from Panjab University, Chandigarh, India. He has 10 years of teaching experience. He has published a number of research papers in reputed International Journals in the area of Natural Language Processing and Information Retrieval.

fields.name: Dr. Anshu Parashar
fields.specialisation: Software Engineering and ICT for Sustainable Development.
fields.biography: Dr. Anshu Parashar did his Ph.D. (2017) from National Institute of Technology, Kurukshetra, India. He has more than 15 years of teaching experience. Presently, he is working as Assistant Professor in Computer Science and Engineering Department at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, Punjab, India. He did B.Tech. (2002) and M.Tech. (2008) in Computer Science and Engineering. He has guided 12 M. Tech. Dissertations. He also qualified GATE and NET exams. He also worked as Member Board of Studies (BOS) of UIET, Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra. His area of interest includes software engineering, database, data mining, software project management, ICT applications for sustainable rural & urban development.

fields.specialisation: Software Engineering, Cultural Computing, Intelligent Databases, Information Retrieval Systems and Machine Learning
fields.biography: Lecturer in Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala, since December 2012. She is also performing her duties as Coordinator for conducting UG Surveys.

fields.name: Shatrughan Modi
fields.biography: Mr. Shatrughan Modi is Lecturer (Contractual) in Computer Science and Engineering Department of Thapar Univrsity, Patiala. He is pursuing part-time PhD from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala under the guidance of Dr. Jhilik Bhattacharya (Assist. Prof. in Computer Science and Engineering Department) and Dr. Prasenjit Basak (Assist. Prof. in Electrical and Instrumentation Engineering Department). He has approx. 4 years of teaching experience and 2 years of industry experience. He has completed his M.E. in Software Engineering and B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering.

fields.name: Dr. Neenu Garg
fields.biography: Neenu Garg received her Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Punjab, India in 2017. She is currently working as a Lecturer in Computer Science and Engineering Department with Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology. Previously, she has worked in Aricent Technologies, Gurgaon, India as a Software Engineer. Her main research interests include cloud computing, information security.

fields.name: Dr. Ashish Girdhar
fields.biography: Dr. Ashish Girdhar is working as Lecturer in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology since July, 2015. He has more than 7 years of teaching experience. He has completed his PhD degree in October 2019. His title of PhD thesis is “Development of Efficient Image Steganography System for 3D Image Models”. He completed his M.Tech in 2012 from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology and B.Tech in 2010 from Kurukshetra University. He has also qualified GATE 2015.

fields.name: Rajanpreet Kaur Chahal
fields.specialisation: Cloud Computing, Distributed Systems, Security and Trust Evaluation in Distributed Systems
fields.biography: Rajanpreet Kaur Chahal is currently working as Lecturer in Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, Punjab, India. She completed her M.E. in Computer Science and Engineering from Panjab University, Chandigarh, India in 2014. She is currently pursuing Ph.D. in Computer Science from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. Her current research interests include trust evaluation in distributed networks.

fields.biography: Swati Kumari is lecturer of Computer Science & Engineering Department , at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Patiala. She has worked as an Assistant Professor at Jharkhand Rai University from july 2014- January 2017 & as a faculty associate from December 2013-july 2014.Has guided MCA & Btech students for their thesis work, has published 8 research papers in different International refereed journals & presented 4 research papers in different International Conferences & 2 research papers in different national conferences. She has worked as a lecturer at Cambridge Institute of Technology from December 2011- July 2012 & july 2013- December 2013. she has qualified gate in the year 2012.She has worked as a software developer at Wipro Technology, New Delhi from September 2010-november 2011.

fields.biography: Ms.Sukhnandan Kaur is currently working as Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala, India. She has over 5 years of experience in Academia. She has various national and international publications to her credit. She is also a reviewer for various renowned International journals. Her area of interest is Natural Language Processing which includes transliteration, Sentiment Analysis.

fields.name: Harpreet Singh
fields.biography: Harpreet Singh is a Lecturer of Computer Science and Engineering Department in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. He was appointed in 2017 in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology,Patiala. Before joining Thapar, He has teaching experience of 5 years. He worked as a teaching assistantship in Chandigarh Group of Colleges, Landran selected under TEQIP (Technical Education Quality Improvement Programme) sponsored by World Bank for 2 years during his Masters. After that, he appointed as a Assistant Professor in Chandigarh University, Mohali in 2014 and served for 3 years. He has filed 3 patents in interdisciplinary fields and also filed 3 research projects in Department of Health Research sponsored by Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India. Apart from this, He organized and conducted the FOSS online exam remotely under “Talk To A Teacher” project offered by the Spoken Tutorial Project, IIT Bombay, funded by National Mission on Education through ICT, MHRD, Govt., of India and generated 150 certifications of students in different programming modules. He also coordinated and started the 5th batch of Tech Mahindra IMS Academy successfully in Chandigarh University. He did the certification in “MACHINE LEARNING FOUNDATIONS: A Case Study Approach” by University of Washington on Coursera. Certificate earned on May7, 2016. His area of research in Machine Learning and Data Mining,Optimization using Softcomputing techniques (GA, DE, PSO, ACO) ,Combinatorial Problems and Bioinformatics (Drug Synergy, Drug Discovery).

fields.name: Ms. Sujata Rani
fields.biography: Ms. Sujata Rani is currently working as Lecturer in Computer Science and Engineering Department. She obtained her B. Tech with distinction from BHSBIET, PTU, Punjab, India, and M.E. from Thapar University, Patiala, India. She is pursuing her Ph.D. degree from TIET, Patiala. She is UGC NET and GATE Qualified.

fields.name: Dr. Manju
fields.biography: Dr. Manju was born in Hansi, India in 1987. She received her B.E. degree in Computer Science in 2008 from MDU, Rohtak. She did her M.Tech. Degree in 2010 from Banasthali Vidyapeeth, Rajasthan in the branch Computer Science. Thereafter she worked with BRCM College of Engineering and Technology Bahal, Bhiwani (Haryana) as an Assistant Professor till June 28, 2012. On July 2, 2012 she joined College of Engineering and Technology, Mody University of Science and Technology, Lakshmangarh (Rajasthan) as an Assistant Professor in Computer Science Department and got her Ph.D. in Engineering from there itself in 2016. On July 15, 2017 she joined Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala (Punjab) as an Assistant Professor. Manju has authored several research Papers in reputed international/national journals and conference/seminar proceedings and supervised M.Tech. dissertations. Her research interest include Energy Efficient Wireless Sensor Networks.

fields.name: Dr. Smita Agrawal
fields.biography: Smita Agrawal is working as a Lecturer in Computer Science and Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She has done her M.C.A. and Ph.D. from B.B.A.U. (A Central University), Lucknow. She has also qualified UGC-NET. She has 7 years’ experience of teaching undergraduate and master level courses such as B.Tech., B.C.A. and M.C.A. During her teaching tenure, she has actively participated in few FDPs and workshops. She has contributed few articles in reputed journals in the field of computer science. Her areas of interest are Image security, reversible watermarking and image encryption.

fields.specialisation: Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
fields.biography: Sahil Sharma is a Lecturer of Computer Science and Engineering Department in Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since August 2019. He has teaching experience of 4 years. Before joining as a lecturer, he has worked as non-tenure lecturer (part-time) in CSED, TIET, Patiala from January 2018 to July 2019. He has worked in teaching associateship from July 2017 to December 2017 in CSED, TIET, Patiala. He has worked as teaching assistant in Thapar University, Patiala under MHRD (Ministry of Human Resource Department) scholarship through GATE CS (Graduate Aptitude Test Engineering in Computer Science and Information Technology) for two years during his Masters. He has qualified GATE CS 2013 exam with 96.7193 percentile (A.I.R. 7352 out of 2,24,160). He has also qualified NTA UGCNET June 2019 in Computer Science and Applications with A.I.R. 98.9071 percentile (A.I.R. 469 out of 42,913). He has worked as a Junior Research Fellow in IIT Mandi, Himachal Pradesh from March 2015 to May 2015 under a DRDO Machine Learning Project. He has done ten weeks course on Programming, Data Structures and Algorithms certification exam in 2014 with NPTEL. His area of research is computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, and 3D face recognition and reconstruction.

fields.name: Mr. Shubham  Goel
fields.biography: Shubham Goel is working as Lecturer in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology since August, 2019. He has more than 2.5 years of teaching experience and 2 years of Industrial experience. Currently he is pursuing PhD in machine learning. He completed his M.Tech in 2015 from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology and B.Tech in 2011 from Maharishi Markandeshwar University, Mullana. He has also qualified UGC-NET and GATE.

fields.name: Sanjeev Rao
fields.biography: Sanjeev Rao is Lecturer in Computer Science and Engineering Department at Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Patiala, Punjab, India. He has more than 10 years of academic and industry experience. He has done B.Tech in 2007 and M.Tech 2012, majoring in Computer Science and Engineering. He is pursuing Ph.D. from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology Patiala. He is an Oracle Certified Professional (OCP) from Oracle University. His areas of interest are Databases (Oracle), Data Science and Cyber Security. He has supervised 3 M.E Thesis and 3 M.E projects. He has successfully mentored many Capstone and ELC-ROBOTIC ARM projects. He has published and presented many papers in International Conferences and Journals. Also, he has worked as Corporate Trainer for delivering trainings/workshops in Oracle. He has also received appreciations for delivering Expert talks and FDP sessions. He is also a member of IEEE, ACM, and IAENG.

fields.biography: Dr. Kumar is a Certified Energy Manager cum Auditor (Bureau of Energy Efficiency). He is the fellow and chartered engineer with Institute of Engineers (IE) India. He had developed an independent research center while being worked as Coordinator of Energy Elite Club. He is actively working as Principal Investigator for the university funded project on “Power and renewable energy management at TIET campus through strategic auditing and benchmarking” Dr. Kumar has worked as the Managing Guest Editor for the Special Issue on “Innovative Technologies for Micro-grid and Smart-grid Systems” of Computers and Electrical Engineering, Elsevier Journal. Dr. Kumar has also been served as a reviewer for reputed journals and conferences including; IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics, IET-Generation, Transmission and Distribution, Elsevier-Electrical Power and Energy Systems, Computers and Electrical Engineering, Springer-Electrical Engineering, IJITWE IGI Global USA, JCIT IGI Global USA, 12th IEEE INDICON-2015 and 2018. He has published several papers/books/book chapters with various journals/conferences of repute including IEEE, IET, Elsevier, Taylor and Frances etc. He has worked as Session Chair and reviewer for ICICS-2016 for the track of power, energy and control. He has also received Best Paper Award during ICICS-2016 International Conference. Dr. Kumar is the editor of a book “Handbook of Research on Power and Energy System Optimization” with, IGI Global, USA. He has delivered expert lectures on Energy Efficiency in Electrical Utilities in various institutions. His area of current interest includes: Energy efficiency in electrical utilities, optimization in power system’s operation and planning, distributed generation, load management and energy auditing, computational intelligence, Innovative technologies for micro-grid and smart-grid systems, Internet of Energy (IoE).

fields.name: Dr. Yogesh Tatte
fields.biography: Dr. Yogesh Tatte is working with EIEDDepartment, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since July 2018. He has completed his PhD degree in Improved Direct Torque Control of Five-Phase Induction Motor from Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Nagpur, Maharashtra in July 2017. His research interests include Electrical Machines, Electrical Drives and Power Electronics.

fields.name: Dr. Ashis Tripathy
fields.biography: Dr. Ashis Tripathy received his Ph.D. degree in Biomedical Engineering from University of Malaya (UM), Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. He was honored with Award of Excellence-2017 for outstanding research contribution in his doctoral research program. He has obtained his M.Tech. degree from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India and B.Tech. from Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Odisha, India. He is currently working as a Postdoctoral research fellow at Center for Micro Electro Mechanics Systems (CMEMS), University of Minho, Portugal. He is also working as an Assistant Professor-II in the department of Electrical and Instrumentation Engineering, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Dr. Tripathy has about 6 years of teaching and 3 years of research experience. His research interests are focused on Biomaterial synthesis, implants, biosensor fabrication, wearable and flexible electronics, Instrumentation and biomedical engineering.

fields.name: Dr. Krishna Kumar Gupta
fields.biography: An avid teacher, researcher, consultant and author, Dr. Krishna Kumar Gupta is currently serving as Assistant Professor. He obtained his B.Tech, M.Tech and Ph.D. degrees from MANIT Bhopal. He is a recipient of Young Scientist Award from MP Council of Science and Technology in 2015. He has 7 years of teaching experience. His current area of research interests includes power converters and LED driving units.

fields.name: Dr.  Sridhar Joshi
fields.biography: Mr. Sridhar Joshi is currently Visiting Assistant Professor in the Electrical and Instrumentation Engineering Department, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Mr. Joshi is pursuing his Ph.D. from IIT Kanpur. He has 4 years of teaching experience. His current area of research includes Class D audio amplifier, DC-DC converters and Non-linear control techniques of power converters.

fields.name: Dr. Rajesh Kumar
fields.biography: Dr. Rajesh Kumar has joined TIET Patiala in July 2019 in the Electrical & Instrumentation Department. He has a keen interest in the application of Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) in the prediction, modeling and adaptive control of nonlinear dynamical systems. His current area of research includes ANN and its structure optimization, stability, modeling, prediction & application of nature inspired algorithms.

fields.name: Dr. Sandeep Pandey
fields.biography: Dr. Sandeep Pandey working with EIEDepartment, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2019. He received the B.E. degree in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering from IET-DAVV, Indore, India in 2007, M.Tech degree(Honours) in Control Systems from Electrical Engineering Dep,IIT(BHU), Varanasi, India in 2013. He was awarded his Ph.D in the Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Nagpur, India. His areas of interest are Fractional order PID controller, Robust Control system, Actuator saturation and anti-windup technique. He has been working on various current issues of fractional order control System. Mr. Pandey has published several papers on fractional order systems in various reputed Journal and international conferences. He received the best paper award from the Institute of control robotics and system South Korea in 2017. He is currently a active reviewer of various SCI/SCIE reputed Journal including IEEE transaction on industrial electronics, ISA transaction and Journal of the Franklin Institute etc. He has been awarded as a outstanding reviewer in 2017 by ISA transaction, Elsevier.

His current area of research interest includes Smart Grid, Electric Vehicle, Vehicle to Grid, Renewable Energy Sources, Smart Building and Distributed Generation. At present he is handling project worth Rs. 16 crore sanctioned by DST, DHI and CSIR..

fields.name: Dr. Saurabh Bhardwaj
fields.specialisation: Statistical and machine learning based solutions for the problems which involves recognition, classification, clustering, modeling, estimation and information retrieval
fields.biography: Dr. Saurabh Bhardwaj received the Ph.D. degree in Instrumentation and Control Engineering from Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology (NSIT), New Delhi, India in 2013 and the M.E. degree in Instrumentation Engineering from Panjab University, Chandigarh in 2008. Currently, he is working as an Associate Professor in Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. Dr. Bhardwaj has about 13 years of teaching and research experience. His current research interests include Biometrics, machine learning and its applications in different fields i.e. automatic speaker recognition, time series prediction and in solar radiation estimation.

fields.name: Dr. Atul Kumar Upadhyay
fields.specialisation: Computational Biology, Genomics and Plant Biotechnology
fields.biography: Dr. Atul Kumar Upadhyay is working as an Assistant professor in Department of Biotechnology, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala since 2019. He completed his Ph.D. degree in Life Sciences, from National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bangalore; Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, A Deemed University, Mumbai. His research work involves NGS based understanding of genome and transcriptome of medicinal plants to understand the societal importance of the selected secondary metabolites. He has also worked on computational approaches to understand protein sequence-structure-function relationships. He uses machine-learning approaches such as Support Vector Machines (SVM), Random Forest (RF) for the classification of biological data to infer their biological functions.
